page.title: 07Corby Gates Farm Alston Moor
page.content: Corby Gates is a{small hill farm, typical of the area. The{Grey Faced {sheep}are fed on grass in summer and home grown turnips and hay with sheep nuts in winter. Annual jobs include - letting the{tups}run with the{ewes}in November;{housing}the ewes in January when they are fed hay twice a day and {wormed; vaccination}takes place in late March three weeks before{lambing; the lambs are put outside with their mothers after birth;{dipping}is done in June and later in the month the ewes are{clipped; haymaking}is from July onwards depending upon the weather;{dipping}is done again in August, after which the lambs are {weaned}from their mothers before being {sold}in early autumn. The farmer supplements his income with a part time job.
